Transcript:
Cassie: Well, Springfield is still here. You never know when you go away for a
few days.

Josh: Well, we are still in the airport,
though. You never know. Outside could be all pod people.

Cassie: So if we were to stay in the
airport, does that mean that our vacation wouldn't be over yet?

Josh: Isn't being with me sort of like being
on vacation all year long?

Cassie: Why, yes, it is, my love. I've got
to get R.J. to that basketball thing.

Josh: Yeah, yeah. He's still watching planes
take off, and Atticus' flight should be in any minute, so...

Cassie: Yes, the man we had to cut our trip
short for. You know, I don't like him one bit.

Josh: I'm sorry. It's just, he doesn't get
through Springfield that often, so...

Cassie: I know. Do you think he's going to
know anything about Sheila?

Josh: Well, he's been the Lewis family
lawyer for about 100 years. So if Sheila was in Oklahoma looking into Billy’s estate, he would certainly know
that.

Cassie: All right. Well, I just hope that
she's not after Billy’s money because he deserves more than that.
Josh: Yes, he does.
Cassie: Good luck.
Josh: Thank you.
Cassie: (Chuckles) You're going to be at R.J.'s thing later, right?
Josh: Yes, ma'am. I will meet you there.
Reva: Hello, Joshua. Welcome home.
Ava: What are you doing here?

Coop: It's the first day of your new job,
and I just wanted to wish you luck.
Ava: Coop...
Coop: What?
Ava: I told you I needed some space.
Coop: Yeah, I know. I get it.

Ava: No, you don't know or else you wouldn't
still be here.

Coop: Ava, it's just a cup of coffee. All
right, call it a break or whatever you want to call it. Look, my route to Co2
comes right past your door here, so you can expect a cup of coffee tomorrow
morning, too.

Ava: If you want to do something nice for
me, give me some space.

Jonathan: And then... uh-huh, this one is
from somebody who's very special and means a lot to your dad. See the card? It
says, "Merry Christmas, Sarah. Love, Tammy."

Lizzie: What are you doing? Checking out the
loot?

Jonathan: Yeah, it's just I've never seen so
much stuff for one kid.

Lizzie: What, are you afraid we're going to
spoil her?

Jonathan: No, it's great. It's just too much
to put together, you know?

Lizzie: I could help. And then after we
could take Sarah to the lake to watch the ice skaters. Or if you feel like
hitting the stores, we are so returning those hideous plates Aunt Alex gave us.
I don't know what she was thinking.

Jonathan: Why don't you go out and have some
fun?
Lizzie: No, it will be fun.

Jonathan: Lizzie, I meant... it's okay. When was the last time you hung out with your
friends or went shopping with your mom? I bet she has returns to make, too.

Lizzie: Okay, why on earth would I want to
do that when I could hang out with my family?

Jonathan: Well, look, I mean, you had a life
before Sarah. I don't want you giving that stuff up.

Lizzie: Okay, well, I don't miss any of
that.

Jonathan: Okay. Look, Lizzie, you know, I
didn't give up my motorcycle, you know? I don't want you to have to give up stuff,
either. Look, our little princess and I are going to have naptime together.
We're going to have father- daughter bonding. She says she wants you to go out.
She just told me that-- first words.

Lizzie: What are you guys going to do
together?

Jonathan: I've got it under control, okay?
Come here.
Lizzie: I don't even know where to go.

Jonathan: Put your coat on. It's cold. You
go wherever you want to go. Don't worry about us.
Lizzie: Okay. Thanks, I guess.
Jonathan: Bye, Mom.
Tammy: Hey, where are you?
Jonathan: Home.
Tammy: I miss you.

Jonathan: Yeah, I need to see you, too. Can
you get to the Beacon later?

Tammy: Are you kidding me? I'll be there
now.
Jonathan: Give me a half hour.
Tammy: Is Lizzie with you?

Jonathan: No, I just talked her into
treating herself to a day out, so... you know, I think she's actually going to
be okay on her own pretty soon.
Tammy: Not soon enough for me.

Jonathan: Well, as soon as this is over, we
won't have to sneak around again ever.
Tammy: Mmm. What will we do for fun?
Jonathan: I'm sure we'll find something.
Tammy: See you soon.
Lizzie: Thank you for coming so fast.

Beth: What's going on? You said it was an
emergency.
Lizzie: I'm losing Jonathan. I can feel it.
Beth: Oh, honey.

Lizzie: Mom, I need to be, like, a real wife
to Jonathan now and I need you to help me.

Beth: Lizzie, have you even had breakfast
yet?

Lizzie: You know, maybe it was the holidays
because I started feeling like Jonathan and I were in a real marriage. But then
he checked out again, and I am positive that it's Tammy.
Jonathan: I was just telling
Lizzie how I was working on the
plumbing under the bar at
Outskirts...
Beth: You know where I found
this?
Cassie's barn after you cheated
on your wife with Tammy.
Jonathan: Are you going to
tell Lizzie?
Beth: I'll have a Bloody Mary. What about Tammy?

Lizzie: Oh, the fact that he can't stop
thinking about her.
Beth: How do you know that?

Lizzie: Because we aren’t... oh, I so don't
want to be talking about this with you.
Beth: You called me.

Lizzie: I know, but it's just that you're my
mom, and it's too weird to just say. It's just... (sighs) Okay, all right. Okay. Pretend that we're at a gas station, you know, the
kind where you can pick self-service or full-service.

Beth: You have never pumped gas in your
life.

Lizzie: Okay, I've seen people do it, okay?
Think of my marriage as the car, okay? And it's running okay on the
self-service thing. Jonathan gets out, gets the gas. Okay. I need Jonathan to
try the full service, because then he can get the gas without getting out of
the car.
Beth: Lizzie, what are you talking about?

Lizzie: We're not sleeping together! I mean,
we're sleeping together, but we're not sleeping together, okay? Just... I need him to let me get his motor running or he's
going to go somewhere else to fill his tank.

Beth: Okay, okay. So you think that if you
sleep with Jonathan, he's going to forget all about Tammy?

Lizzie: Okay, no, no. Okay? He can't fall
out of love with Tammy and fall in love with me until I've had a chance to show
him that I can give him everything he could want from a marriage. It's not
going to be some drunken one-night stand. He is, like, 99% my husband, and I'm
a good wife. I'm good at that.

Beth: There are a lot of things that go into
a marriage, honey.

Lizzie: I know. I know, and we have every
single one except...
Beth: Except love. It's not the same thing.

Lizzie: Will you just help me? Will you
just... please.
Beth: How? How am I supposed to do that?

Lizzie: I... I've kind of got it all figured
out.
Ava: Good morning, Alan-Michael.

Alan-Michael: Good morning. I haven't even
told you what we're doing yet.

Ava: Well, you'd better hurry up, because
I'm ready to go.

Alan-Michael: Well, do you want some coffee
or something?

Ava: No thanks. Black,
right? Two sugars.

Alan-Michael: Ava, you don't have to get my
coffee. You're not my assistant anymore.

Ava: Well, you haven't given me anything
else to do.

Alan-Michael: You've been here like one
minute.
Ava: Do you want me to get on that 10:30 conference call for you? It's not a problem.

Alan-Michael: I want you to slow down and
enjoy the first day of your promotion.

Ava: I don't want to slow down. I'm here to
work, right? I'm ready to go.

Reva: I mean, really, what's the big deal? I
just wanted to surprise you.

Josh: Like crashing my meeting with my
lawyer.

Reva: Shh. People in airports don't like to
hear people using the word "crashing," Joshua.

Josh: Reva, I've always had a pretty good
working relationship with Atticus, and I'd kind of like to do this on my own.
Reva: It's not like I don't know the guy.
Josh: I'd kind of like to do this on my own.
Reva: Yeah, I heard you the first time.
Josh: But you're not leaving.

Reva: You think this is really how I wanted
to spend my morning?
Josh: Why are you here?

Reva: Because I introduced Billy to Sheila,
the money magnet. I feel responsible.
Josh: You are responsible.

Reva: Well, fine. Then go home and let me
handle the meeting.
Josh: Billy is my brother, Reva.
Reva: And he's my ex-husband.

Josh: Oh, I see this. You do this kind of
thing for all your exes? Is that the way it works?

Reva: There may be one I wouldn't do it for,
believe me.
Josh: Because, you know what? I can...

Atticus: I'll be darned. All these years and
nothing's changed with you two. (Laughs)
Cassie: Hello.
Tammy: Hey. How was skiing?

Cassie: Well, I'm still walking, so that's a
good thing.
Tammy: Good.

Cassie: I'll tell you all about it after the
movie.
Tammy: Mom, wait.
Cassie: I don't want to miss the trailers.

Tammy: I know, but I can't stay for the
movie. I'm sorry.

Cassie: You met me at the movies to say you
can't go to the movies? Honey, it's our post-Christmas tradition. You know,
sappy chick flick and popcorn and lots of butter?
Tammy: Jonathan called.
Cassie: Oh.
Tammy: It's not easy for him to get away.

Cassie: Well, honey, I can't go later
because R.J. has a basketball game.

Tammy: Well, I have time for a coffee right
now.
Cassie: I'll take what I can get.
Tammy: Okay.

Cassie: Oh, honey, we missed you on the
slopes.
Tammy: Oh, were you really on the slopes?

Cassie: We missed you in the lodge with the
cocoa.
Tammy: Uh-huh. (Laughter)

Cassie: Hey, Buzz. Does it matter where we
sit?
Buzz: Well, a chair would be, you know...
Cassie: We'll take them. Thanks.
Tammy: Thank you.

Cassie: So how was Christmas? You went to Gus
and Harley’s? Yeah, I didn't think so.
Tammy: You talk to them?
Cassie: No, I just had a feeling.

Tammy: Mom, it was not... just don't be like that, okay? It actually turned out to be the
best Christmas I ever had once Jonathan showed up.
Cassie: What do you mean once he showed up?

Tammy: It was his daughter's first Christmas,
Mom.
Cassie: Yeah, and...?

Tammy: So, I waited for him at Outskirts for
a while, that's all, and it took him a little longer than he thought.

Cassie: You spent your Christmas alone in a
bar?
Tammy: I told you, he showed up.

Cassie: My daughter spent her Christmas
alone in a bar?

Tammy: Okay, only because you left me all
alone so you could go show off all your cute little
ski outfits in front of your boyfriend. Kidding, Mom.
It wasn't like that, okay? I chose to be there. I knew that Jonathan would come
and be with me eventually.
Cassie: How long did you wait for him?
Tammy: He had responsibilities.
Cassie: How long, Tammy?

Tammy: This whole sneaking around thing, by
the way, is almost over.
Cassie: Over how?

Tammy: Jonathan said it himself. He's
leaving Lizzie.

Jonathan: Hey. I got your message. What's
wrong? Are you okay?

Lizzie: Yeah. I'm sorry if it sounded so
dramatic. I just had to get you here.
Jonathan: What?

Lizzie: You told me to do whatever I wanted
today, and I wanted to surprise you. There's a limo around back. The Spaulding
jet is waiting. We're going on our honeymoon.

Cassie: You know what I find comforting?
Routine, consistency; you and me sitting here with our drinks, and you telling
me once again how Jonathan says he's leaving Lizzie.

Tammy: You know, he
tried to make it work with her. He really did.
Cassie: Mm-hmm.

Tammy: He wanted that for Sarah. But we both
realized that, Mom, we can't not be with each other.
We tried, we failed, the end.
Cassie: Or it's just the beginning.
Tammy: Okay, I heard that.
Cassie: Yeah, I know. I said it out loud.

Tammy: Okay, look, it's only until Jonathan’s
sure that Lizzie can make it on her own.
Cassie: And what does that mean?

Tammy: He just needs to be sure that she'll
be okay without him there all time, that she can take care of herself, maybe
meet somebody new.
Cassie: Yeah, sure sounds easy.

Tammy: Okay, look, you're the one who said
that this would get complicated. Can't you just enjoy the fact that you were
right?

Cassie: No, honey, I wish I could but I
can't because ending a marriage is a big deal.
Tammy: Everything okay with you and Josh?
Cassie: What? Yeah, why?

Tammy: Well, you guys don't have the easiest
relationship either. A marriage ended there, too.

Cassie: Honey, that
is not the same thing. First of all, Reva is more than capable of being on her
own. And secondly, that marriage is already officially over. Josh and I are...
we are stronger than ever.
Tammy: Good. I am happy for you.
Cassie: Thank you.

Tammy: Now you, please, be
happy for me, okay? Got to go. Love you.
Cassie: Love you. (Sighs)
Reva: Okay.
Atticus: You can take Cross Creek out of Oklahoma, but you can't take Oklahoma out of Cross Creek.

Reva: (Laughs) What?
He wanted to come here.

Atticus: I don't have long until my
conference. Now, this is about Billy?
Josh: Yes...
Reva: Yes, it is. It’s...

Josh: Yeah, Billy has this new lady that
he's seeing. Her name is Sheila and we know that she's been to Oklahoma recently.

Atticus: Yeah, yeah. She came to see me. You
two have a new addition?
Reva: Oh, yeah.
Atticus: Well, why didn't you tell me? Josh, you old dog.
Reva: Actually, it's Jonathan’s baby, Sarah.
Atticus: Sarah!
Reva: Yeah.
Atticus: Well, congratulations.
Reva: Thank you, thank you.
Atticus: Your mother would love that.
Reva: Thanks, Atticus.

Josh: Okay, okay, okay. About
Sheila.

Atticus: Oh, yes. Well, she wanted a crash
course in Lewis family history. Asked to see old photographs,
family papers. Billy could have just taken her to see this place. "Always."

Reva: Oh, well, it's not "Always"
anymore because he doesn't live here anymore. He's moved out.
Josh: We're divorced.
Atticus: Again? Well, I'll be.
Josh: So, Sheila.

Atticus: Ah, yes, yes. Well, this is all I
showed her. It's mostly pictures. Nice girl. Can I take a look around?

Reva: Absolutely, Atticus. Please, help
yourself.
Josh: Sure, knock yourself out.
Atticus: Divorced.

Reva: I guess it was asking too much to hope
that Sheila really was just wanting a crash course on
the family. What is it, Joshua?
Josh: It's us about a million years ago.
Reva: Oh. (Chuckles) That was taken the night of our first real kiss.
(Dishes clanging)
Buzz: Rough morning?

Coop: No, not at all. Come on. You know, we
should really get paper. It's a lot less to wash.

Buzz: Yeah, that'll really give some class
to the joint. So, rough morning?

Coop: Dad, we're supposed to be in England. You know why we're supposed to be in England? Because there's no Alan-Michael, there's no Jeffrey,
there's no... I am just sick of people jerking Ava around.
Buzz: Where is Ava now?

Coop: She's at her new job right now, the
one that Alan-Michael just gave her. All right, he gave her this huge promotion
just to keep her in town, which I found out about before she did.
Buzz: And you didn't tell her about it?

Coop: Jeffrey O’Neill was at the airport
looking for her. I got rid of him before she saw me.
Buzz: And she found out about that?
Coop: I was just trying to protect her...
Buzz: Oh, she must have loved that.

Coop: Dad, if something good comes from it,
like a better job, a promotion, fine, that's great. But Jeffrey
O’Neill? All right, he comes to the airport with a gift in his hand like
he's Santa Claus. I mean, what am I supposed to do at that point, you know?

Olivia: Excuse me. Jeffrey showed up with a
gift?

Coop: Yeah. I don't know why he even
bothered, though. I mean, I asked him about it and he said that he still wasn't
even ready to be her father. Dad, I love this woman so much and I can't just
stand around and let people use her.
Buzz: Coop, did you apologize?

Coop: No. I didn’t... I'm not going to
apologize. I'm not sorry for anything I did. You know what? In fact, I would
even do it all again.

Alan-Michael: You know,
I had a colleague overseas, Alice. The year she got divorced, she put up record
numbers. She was a powerhouse, got bonuses left and right. I sent her ex a thank-you
note.

Ava: You know what? I don't want to talk
about this right now.
Alan-Michael: So you and Coop are over?

Ava: I can't hear you. Look, I just want to
stand on my own two feet. I'm sick of people shoving me around and telling me
what to do.
Alan-Michael: Coop.
Ava: I didn't say Coop.
Alan-Michael: Coop.

Ava: I don't want to talk about this right
now.

Alan-Michael: Hey, hey, hey. I don't think
you should be operating any heavy machinery in this condition.
Ava: It's not a bulldozer.
Alan-Michael: It has blades.

Ava: I'm all about work right now. I want to
learn as much as I can. I want to learn as much as I can from you. I'm serious.
No one pushes you around. You've managed to figure out how to take control of
your life.

Alan-Michael: It's not a big secret. You
just get a gut feeling and go with it. Don't let anyone stop you.

Ava: That's it? I gotta take care of
something if you don't mind.
Alan-Michael: Don't ask. Just go with it.

You say I've changed but you're the only one
that knows

and we've made mistakes oh, isn't that the way that it
goes?
Don't be afraid of living this love out loud
you know it's our time...

Lizzie: Can you please get Sarah set up in
the car?
Bob: Okay.
Jonathan: I can do that.

Lizzie: No, no, no. Bob can do it. So, are you
surprised?
Jonathan: Yeah.
Lizzie: Good.

Jonathan: Lizzie, this is supposed to be
your day. We have Sarah. The bar is not going to run itself...

Lizzie: Uh-uh. I already talked to Billy.
He's taking care of the bar, and we're bringing Sarah with us. What, did you
think I was just going to leave her behind?
Jonathan: No. Honeymoon?

Lizzie: You know,
we don't have to bring everything. It's not like we're going to be gone
forever.
Jonathan: We don't have to go anywhere.

Lizzie: Jonathan, we got married in the
street, we had our baby in the car. You know, I want this for us, for all three
of us, some time together, you know, just to get away from everything. And so
it's not going to be the typical honeymoon with the baby on board, but so what?
We're not a typical family.

Jonathan: Right. So we don't even need to go
on a honeymoon.

Lizzie: I know. I thought I wanted typical,
but I do like the way we are and you're so good with Sarah and with me. You
know, it feels like it's all coming together and that means so much to me.
Jonathan: Lizzie, I know, but...

Lizzie: I know. Listen, I know that we're
not a perfect family, but maybe there's no such thing, okay? If a couple of
screw-ups like us can make this work for our daughter so that she can have a
mom and a dad and the love that we missed out on growing up, come on, how cool
would that be?
Jonathan: Very cool. Lizzie... stop tugging on me!

Lizzie: Okay, listen to me. If it freaks you
out, okay, don't call it a honeymoon. Just call it the special trip that kicked
off the rest off our lives. I need it, and Sarah needs it, and I think you need
it.
Jonathan: I have to pack...

Lizzie: Everything is waiting for us on the
island.
Jonathan: The island?!
Lizzie: Let's go. Come on.
Jonathan: Oh...

Gina Tognoni "Inside The
Light."

Rob is a warrior. He's a spiritual warrior.
He's such a pleasure to work with. He's light. He's so consistent the way he
comes to work and is prepared and, you know, even when we like to work, you
know, light on our feet, if we're not so familiar with the material he's just a
joy. He's very grounded.

See Dinah Wednesday, January 3, "Inside
The Light."
Jonathan: I have to leave a note for Billy.
Lizzie: I already talked to him!

Jonathan: Lizzie, there's a thing with the
pack kegs. You don't understand. Wow, girl. Okay, come here, come here. You go
take care of Sarah, I'll be right there.
Lizzie: Okay, okay.
Jonathan: Okay. Okay.
Lizzie: Happy honeymoon, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Okay! (Laughing) Oh! (Sighs) (phone rings)

Jonathan: Hey, it's me. So Lizzie surprised
me with a trip to the Spaulding island house. She's calling it a honeymoon and
I can't get out of it. But we won’t... you know. I'll think of something.
Sarah's coming with us. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I can't get out of this.

Lizzie: Come on, you. Billy will figure it
out. Come on.
Coop: Olivia took off pretty fast.

Buzz: You know, she
went off on an errand. So we can talk about her. In a good
way. She's my fiancée.
Coop: Just hearing you say fiancée...

Buzz: Hey! Hey, you, don't knock it unless
you tried it.

Coop: Oh, excuse me. I did try it with Lizzie,
and now I can't even handle a girlfriend.

Buzz: You know,
some girls just don't want to be handled. You're making the same mistake with Ava
that I made with Olivia.

Coop: Excuse me, Dad, I told you. I'm not
apologizing for anything I said.

Buzz: Would you listen to me? She's her
mother's daughter, for God's sake. I tried, you know, protecting, saving Olivia.
It doesn't work. They're too stubborn. They want to own their mistakes. They
want to own their mistakes no matter how much it hurts.

Coop: Oh, really? Okay, so what are you
telling me to do? Are you telling me just to sit back and let Ava look for
trouble here? Is that what you're trying to tell me?

Buzz: No, Olivia looks for trouble. I think Ava
sort of just steps in it by accident.

Coop: Exactly, that's what the difference
is. All right, yes, Olivia got screwed over in the past, right? But now it
seems like she's the one that's doing the screwing over.
Buzz: Hey, watch it!

Coop: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Okay, listen. All
I'm trying to say to you is that Ava is a nice person. She's a good person, she doesn't look to hurt people, okay? And she
certainly doesn't deserve what she's been hit with. I mean, nowadays it looks
like this committee that's designated to just doing nothing but trying to use
her.
Buzz: Coop...
Coop: What?
Buzz: Do you love her?
Coop: Yes, I love her, Dad.
Buzz: Can you live without her?
Coop: No, I can't live without her.

Buzz: Well, then, fight for her. That's what
I did. I fought and I won, so...
Coop: Can you cover for me?
Buzz: Where are you going?
Coop: I just remembered I got an errand.

Buzz: Lot
of that going around.
Jeffrey: You're back. Why?

Ava: I'm wearing them. The earrings that you
gave me, or bought for me, or... the nurse said that she had a gift with my
name on it.
Jeffrey: They're nothing.
Ava: Turquoise is actually my birthstone.
Jeffrey: They're just earrings.

Ava: I know why you got beat up, Jeffrey. I
know you came to the airport, too. I don't know what to make of the airport.

Jeffrey: Well, don't think too much about
it, okay?

Ava: But I do know that I don't want you
cutting me out of your life before I've even had a chance to be in it.

Olivia: Jeffery, I didn't bring you
flowers...
Reva: How old were we here? What, about 14?
Josh: We were kids. Didn't know nothing from nothing.

Reva: Oh, no. We knew one thing. I remember
the night this was taken. It had rained all afternoon and I was so worried that
my hair was going to frizz. I knew I was going to see you that day so I put on
my best dress, which just happened to be this very dress. You were going to take
me to the dance on the hill. I felt like I was the prettiest girl in Oklahoma. Until I looked in the window and
saw the other girls in their pretty dresses. I couldn't do it. I
couldn't go in and you knew it, but you didn't say anything. You just danced with
me on top of that hill. Outside, under the stars. The
grass had that rain-soaked smell and... and then you
kissed me. Remember, Bud?

Josh: You tell that story the same way every
time.
Reva: Good story. Good memory.
Josh: We better get back to this thing... (clears throat)
Reva: Right.

Reva: We should really put these pictures in
some kind of an album. They're turning yellow they're so old.

Josh: This is exactly what I was hoping we
wouldn't find.
Reva: What?

Josh: Legal documentation. In the event of Billy’s
death, his estate goes to Bill, Dylan, and Mindy, unless, of course, he has a
wife.

Reva: And then the wife gets everything?
That's exactly what Sheila was looking for.

Josh: Yeah. Well, if you're right about that
it's going to break Billy’s heart...
Reva: Not until I break her legs.

Josh: Wait a minute. Come on, now, where are
you going?

Reva: I'm going to pay a little visit to
that gold digging tramp.

Josh: Not like this, okay? We haven't even
heard her side.
Reva: Her side?

Josh: We play nice. We give her a chance to
explain herself, all right, otherwise we're going to
blow the whole thing.
Reva: Okay! I can play nice. Don't call her.
Josh: I'm not calling her, I'm calling Cassie.

Reva: Well, call her on the way. We have to
get to Sheila and... we'll be very nice.
Josh: Reva. Reva!
Alan-Michael: She's not here. (With English accent): Aren't you supposed to be in Stratford- on-Avon chugging pints and playing hamlet?

Coop: Funny. Ava deserves to move up at Spaulding
because she gets any job you give her done and she works very hard for you.
Alan-Michael: I'm glad you agree, Coop.

Coop: Hmm. Right. Well, I think I know the
real reason why she got the promotion, and I don't think it's because of her
job performance.

Alan-Michael: Her job performance is
excellent.

Coop: I'm not going to just sit back here
and watch you win.

Alan-Michael: Is that why you're here? I
